10b35bf3-25a8-43b9-811f-207756cf5586.description: The vendor-neutral CISSP credential confirms technical knowledge and experience to design, engineer, implement, and manage the overall security posture of an organization. Required by the world’s most security-conscious organizations, CISSP is the gold-standard information security certification that assures information security leaders possess the breadth and depth of knowledge to establish holistic security programs that protect against threats in an increasingly complex cyber world.
10b35bf3-25a8-43b9-811f-207756cf5586.name: Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP)

alignments.name: ISO/IEC 17024:2012
alignments.description: ISO/IEC 17024:2012 contains principles and requirements for a body certifying persons against specific requirements, and includes the development and maintenance of a certification scheme for persons.

badge_template_activities.title: Obtain the required experience
Achieve a passing score on the CISSP exam
Obtain an endorsement from an existing (ISC)² member
Subscribe to the Code of Ethics
Complete continuing professional education requirements

67e81855-20b9-47a8-a15b-0d2f3e0f1957.description: (ISC)² Candidates are individuals pursuing or considering a cybersecurity certification. To become a Candidate, the individual must apply online and provide minimum identifying information, as well as affirm that they will abide by the (ISC)² Code of Ethics and Privacy Policy.
67e81855-20b9-47a8-a15b-0d2f3e0f1957.name: (ISC)² Candidate

badge_template_activities.title: (ISC)² Candidates agree to the (ISC)² Privacy Policy
(ISC)² Candidates will create an account with (ISC)² and agree to abide by the Code of Ethics
After their first year, (ISC)² Candidates are required to pay annual dues to maintain status

skills.name: An (ISC)² Candidate is a part of a diverse community of cybersecurity professionals working to build a safe and secure cyber world.
(ISC)² Candidates build connections with our membership of leading minds that will open doors far into their future.
(ISC)² Candidates have access to benefits ranging from discounts across education and professional development plus engagement and community opportunities.

f1ac8d8b-2ca3-4b7d-b132-3f813c51e7cc.description: The vendor-neutral CC credential starts newcomers on their path to advanced cybersecurity certifications and future leadership roles. It proves to organizations that newly certified team members understand fundamental security principles and operations, network security and access controls and that they have the skills to meet and exceed performance standards in their beginning roles. All this allows organizations to build a stronger line of defense.
f1ac8d8b-2ca3-4b7d-b132-3f813c51e7cc.name: Certified in Cybersecurity (CC)

badge_template_activities.title: Achieve a passing score on the CC exam
Subscribe to the Code of Ethics
Complete continuing professional education requirements

e2b1fd28-6f52-4c35-8498-fd425e530946.description: The Associate of (ISC)² status allows an individual to demonstrate competence in the field by passing the rigorous CISSP exam, and work toward gaining the experience required to become CISSP certified. The vendor-neutral CISSP credential confirms technical knowledge and experience to design, engineer, implement, and manage the overall security posture of an organization.
e2b1fd28-6f52-4c35-8498-fd425e530946.name: Associate of (ISC)²

badge_template_activities.title: Achieve a passing score on the CISSP exam
Subscribe to the Code of Ethics
Complete continuing professional education requirements

4e0a30fe-e4a3-4d5d-8f7e-3de41ddc5645.description: The vendor-neutral CCSP credential confirms knowledge and competency in applying best practices to cloud security architecture, design, operations, and service orchestration. Developed by the two leading non-profits in cloud and information security, CSA and (ISC)², the CCSP draws from a comprehensive, up-to-date global body of knowledge that ensures candidates have the right cloud security knowledge and skills to be successful in securing and optimizing cloud computing environments.
4e0a30fe-e4a3-4d5d-8f7e-3de41ddc5645.name: Certified Cloud Security Professional (CCSP)

badge_template_activities.title: Obtain the required experience
Achieve a passing score on the CCSP exam
Obtain an endorsement from an existing (ISC)² member
Subscribe to the Code of Ethics
Complete continuing professional education requirements

f87adfc8-f1d0-4240-ab76-ede87831017e.description: The vendor-neutral SSCP credential confirms deep technical knowledge and competency in implementing, monitoring, and administering IT Infrastructure in accordance with information security policies and requirements across the organization. The SSCP credential draws from a comprehensive, up-to-date global body of knowledge that ensures candidates have the right information security knowledge and skills to be successful in IT operational roles.
f87adfc8-f1d0-4240-ab76-ede87831017e.name: Systems Security Certified Practitioner (SSCP)

f85e8e53-687f-4db0-9432-cac4656472ae.description: The Associate of (ISC)² status allows an individual to demonstrate competence in the field by passing the rigorous SSCP exam, and work toward gaining the experience required to become SSCP certified. The vendor-neutral SSCP credential confirms deep technical knowledge and competency in implementing, monitoring, and administering IT Infrastructure in accordance with information security policies and requirements across the organization.
f85e8e53-687f-4db0-9432-cac4656472ae.name: Associate of (ISC)²

ce480726-260a-4bf3-ba3f-61bfd8686e13.description: The vendor-neutral CAP credential confirms the advanced technical skills and knowledge to understand and apply Governance, Risk and Compliance (GRC) and can authorize and maintain information systems utilizing various risk management frameworks, and best practices, policies and procedures. CAP validates that an authorization professional has the competence to ensure that information systems have security equivalent with the level of exposure to potential risk and damage to assets or individuals.
ce480726-260a-4bf3-ba3f-61bfd8686e13.name: Certified Authorization Professional (CAP)

badge_template_activities.title: Obtain the required experience

e53e55c6-effd-4667-8870-2ec73210533e.description: The vendor-neutral CSSLP credential validates that software professionals have the expertise to incorporate security practices – authentication, authorization and auditing – into each phase of the software development lifecycle, from software design and implementation to testing and deployment. CSSLP confirms one’s knowledge to reduce loss of revenue and reputation due to a breach resulting from insecure software, while enhancing the credibility of an organization and its development team.
e53e55c6-effd-4667-8870-2ec73210533e.name: Certified Secure Software Lifecycle Professional (CSSLP)

2fe74d94-80c1-453d-8382-58f8b473c2dd.description: The vendor-neutral HCISPP credential validates the core knowledge and experience needed to implement, manage, or assess the appropriate security and privacy controls of a healthcare organization. HCISPP validates that a practitioner understands the best practices and techniques to protect organizations and sensitive patient data against emerging threats and breaches.

d3eb1164-250d-4ff8-ba4b-4ef914bbc0bc.description: Professionals who earn this badge have volunteered to serve in (ISC)² exam development workshops. These certified cybersecurity professionals have written, revised, and/or reviewed exam items for the certification they hold. During exam development workshops, professionals update exam outlines and participate in standard setting.
d3eb1164-250d-4ff8-ba4b-4ef914bbc0bc.name: Cybersecurity Exam Development Volunteer

badge_template_activities.title: Served in (ISC)² exam development pool
Must complete a full workshop and earn 21 CPEs
Complete end of workshop survey
Holds (ISC)² certification

2287d615-97d9-47ac-9a1e-876d8e0cd9ed.description: The first of 3 courses, badge holder has a solid understanding of cloud computing including key drivers and rationale for moving to the cloud, cloud architecture and computing concepts and characteristics, cloud service and deployment models, and cloud brokers. The Cloud Security Certificate program is designed for cybersecurity professionals and others interested in demonstrating their knowledge of cloud security. Courses include: Cloud Basics, Moving to the Cloud, and Working in the Cloud.
2287d615-97d9-47ac-9a1e-876d8e0cd9ed.name: Cloud Basics (1 of 3) - ISC2 Cloud Security Certificate Program

badge_template_activities.title: Complete all the course requirements in the Cloud Basics Course.

skills.name: Solid understanding of cloud computing including key drivers and rationale for moving to the cloud

9348ee4c-76b2-4dac-b813-04ffc837047f.description: The Associate of (ISC)² status allows an individual to demonstrate competence in the field by passing the rigorous HCISPP exam, and work toward gaining the experience required to become HCISPP certified. 626c891b-d1e3-4078-b86f-851cf91b72fc.description: The Secure Software Practitioner – Java certificate validates the foundational skills to write more secure software and reduce vulnerabilities and re-work. This certificate requires knowledge of secure software concepts, secure software design, OWASP top 10, secure software coding, and defending Java.
626c891b-d1e3-4078-b86f-851cf91b72fc.name: Secure Software Practitioner – Java

e05528d6-735a-49b9-b96f-c0b3853fad40.description: The third of 3 courses, badge holder has a solid understanding of a security professional within an organization, who will need to think critically, apply knowledge, and make decisions to determine the best solution regarding cloud security challenges. The Cloud Security Certificate program is designed for cybersecurity professionals and other professionals interested in demonstrating their knowledge of cloud security. Courses include: Cloud Basics, Moving to the Cloud, and Working in the Cloud.
e05528d6-735a-49b9-b96f-c0b3853fad40.name: Working in the Cloud (3 of 3)- ISC2 Cloud Security Certificate Program

badge_template_activities.title: Complete all the course requirements in the Working in the Cloud Course.

e61e48ef-ff77-462c-b62d-06e1e5c037f8.description: The second in a series of three courses, badge holder has a solid understanding four-phased approach to transforming your organization — strategically and securely — using business alignment as your guidepost. The Cloud Security Certificate program is designed for cybersecurity professionals and other professionals interested in demonstrating their knowledge of cloud security. Courses include: Cloud Basics, Moving to the Cloud, and Working in the Cloud.

b8632888-3142-4477-8f22-bcfe67ab4f63.description: The first in a series of three courses, badge holder has a solid understanding of risk assessment, analysis, mitigation, remediation, and talk. Courses include: Conducting Practical Risk Analysis, Exploring Risk Standards and Practical Risk Methods.

79c98824-5f80-4bbd-b6f1-5f25c7ccfdf4.description: The first in a series of five courses, badge holder has a solid understanding of the NIST Cybersecurity Framework (CSF) and to be able to apply it to their organization, large and small, using a matrix that incorporates all of the popular technical standards. This CISO Leadership Certificate program is designed for cybersecurity professionals and other professionals interested in demonstrating their knowledge of CISO Leadership.
79c98824-5f80-4bbd-b6f1-5f25c7ccfdf4.name: Introduction to NIST Cybersecurity Framework (1 of 5) - ISC2 CISO Leadership Certificate Program

badge_template_activities.title: Complete all the course requirements in the Introduction to NIST Cybersecurity Framework Course.

95a8dda6-dffe-4432-9b21-a9c9d4cc18d6.description: The third in a series of five courses, badge holder has a solid understanding of the following three questions: How do you define a security incident? How do you prevent an incident from becoming a breach? How can security incidents be leveraged as an opportunity to improve your organization's security posture? This CISO Leadership Certificate program is designed for cybersecurity professionals and other professionals interested in demonstrating their knowledge of CISO Leadership.

6242d4b9-01cd-4b54-b4e5-56268ac716da.description: The third in a series of three courses, badge holder has a solid understanding of qualitative and quantitative methods in order to foster consistent and effective estimates of organizational assets and risks. Techniques for better comparison and measurement of risks focused on methods for calculating value while assessing and prioritizing risk.

The iOS suite teaches coding techniques to defend against vulnerabilities such as insecure data storage, weak server side controls, lack of binary protections, and more.

skills.name: Acquired the knowledge of what constitutes a healthcare organization and how healthcare information technologies and data management affect privacy and security.

6ed8d899-c0b7-443d-b9e5-6eef0da4c004.description: The Secure Software Practitioner – Project Manager certificate validates the foundational skills for analyzing the full development lifecycle, depicting secure coding, requirements and design.  Those holding this credential have the ability to define important security criteria to allow software to be promoted for release.
